lead_paragraph: CUCCI--Cesare E.,M.D., died at his home on April 29, 2016. Born in Spoleto, Italy on December 22, 1925 to Anna Morelli and Ottorino Cucci, he graduated from the University of Perugia Faculty of Medicine and Surgery and did his medical training in London and New York. Nonno, as he was affectionately called, maintained a private pediatric cardiology practice for over 20 years in Manhattan. For many years he was also chief of the pediatric cardiology unit at Lenox Hill Hospital in New York and a professor of clinical pediatrics at New York University Medical School. Upon retirement from private practice, Dr. Cucci was Director of Clinical Development at Wyeth-Ayerst Research for several years prior to his full retirement in 1996. Dr. Cucci is survived by his wife of 50 years Dr. Gilda Morillo-Cucci, his three children Susanna, Gardenia and Sergio and five grandchildren Gavin, Luke, Tommaso, Giorgiana and Penelope. 1/3
